intro: Mammillaria ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman’s mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, spherical shape and is covered in short, white spines. The plant typically has a yellowish-green stem with areoles that bear both spines and flowers. It produces small, pink to red flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
